intro: Hakea synapheae, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hakea, is a shrub native to southwestern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and distinctive, cylindrical flower spikes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. Hakea synapheae is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for native wildlife.
